content.title: Duplicated Inferior Vena Cava
content.description: Congenital anomaly with bilateral IVCs, persisting from both supracardinal veins during embryologic development.

clinical_features.anatomy: Left IVC joins left renal vein, crosses to right IVC

clinical_implications.ivc_filter: May require bilateral filters for complete protection
clinical_implications.dvt_paradox: Left-sided DVT may propagate via left IVC even with right filter
clinical_implications.surgical_planning: Important for aortic surgery, retroperitoneal procedures

diagnosis.cavography: May miss if only right side injected

treatment_considerations.ivc_filter: Consider suprarenal filter or bilateral filters
treatment_considerations.dvt: Standard treatment, but ensure filter coverage

content.clinical_pearl: In patient with IVC filter and recurrent PE, consider unfiltered duplicated IVC
content.statement: Duplicated Inferior Vena Cava is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Congenital that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Duplicated Inferior Vena Cava helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Duplicated Inferior Vena Cava include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Duplicated Inferior Vena Cava.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Duplicated Inferior Vena Cava. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
